result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M. Wanish

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:52 p.m.  Atty. Harrison specially appears on behalf of Atty. Heim. 
7/15/22 letter inducement.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  8/26/22, 8:30 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph M. Wanish in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Joseph M. Wanish. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives time limits.
Preliminary hearing set for 07-15-2022 at 1:30pm
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:34 AM Defendant Joseph M. Wanish in court.  Attorney Jill L. Vendetti in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim in court for Joseph M. Wanish by special appearance. 
Defense requests an adjournment as this is a felony matter and the Public Defender has not found counsel for the defendant yet.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of operate under the influence - 5th offense and possess methamphetamine.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-23-22 at 9:30 a.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.    Bail is furnished and the defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
